content:
TITLE: Installing PyTorch for FramePack (Linux Shell) DESCRIPTION: Installs the required PyTorch, torchvision, and torchaudio libraries using pip, specifically targeting the versions compatible with CUDA 12.6 via the specified index URL. This is a prerequisite for running FramePack on Linux. SOURCE: https://github.com/lllyasviel/framepack/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: Shell CODE: ``` pip install torch torchvision torchaudio --index-url https://download.pytorch.org/whl/cu126 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing FramePack Dependencies (Linux Shell) DESCRIPTION: Installs all Python package dependencies listed in the `requirements.txt` file using pip. This command should be run in the FramePack project directory after installing PyTorch and cloning the repository. SOURCE: https://github.com/lllyasviel/framepack/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: Shell CODE: ``` pip install -r requirements.txt ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Launching FramePack Gradio Demo (Linux Shell/Python) DESCRIPTION: Executes the `demo_gradio.py` script using the Python interpreter to launch the Gradio web interface for FramePack on Linux. Assumes Python 3.10 and required dependencies are installed. Optional arguments like `--share`, `--port`, `--server` can be appended. SOURCE: https://github.com/lllyasviel/framepack/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: Shell CODE: ``` python demo_gradio.py ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running FramePack on Windows (Batch) DESCRIPTION: Executes the `run.bat` script on Windows to start the FramePack application's graphical user interface. This command is used after installation and optionally after running `update.bat`. SOURCE: https://github.com/lllyasviel/framepack/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: Batch CODE: ``` run.bat ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Updating FramePack on Windows (Batch) DESCRIPTION: Executes the `update.bat` script on Windows to update the FramePack software to the latest version. This should be run after extracting the one-click package and before running the application to ensure bug fixes are applied. SOURCE: https://github.com/lllyasviel/framepack/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: Batch CODE: ``` update.bat ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Listing Python Package Dependencies for framepack DESCRIPTION: This snippet lists the Python packages required for the framepack project. It specifies exact versions for libraries like accelerate, diffusers, transformers, and gradio, while others like einops and opencv-contrib-python are listed without explicit versions. These dependencies support functionalities including machine learning acceleration, diffusion models, natural language processing, user interfaces, image/video handling, and numerical operations. SOURCE: https://github.com/lllyasviel/framepack/blob/main/requirements.txt#_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: Requirements CODE: ``` accelerate==1.6.0 diffusers==0.33.1 transformers==4.46.2 gradio==5.23.0 sentencepiece==0.2.0 pillow==11.1.0 av==12.1.0 numpy==1.26.2 scipy==1.12.0 requests==2.31.0 torchsde==0.2.6 einops opencv-contrib-python safetensors ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing Sage Attention (Optional, Linux Shell) DESCRIPTION: Installs a specific version (1.0.6) of the optional `sageattention` library using pip on Linux. This library provides an alternative attention mechanism that might affect performance and results; usage is recommended only after verifying baseline functionality. SOURCE: https://github.com/lllyasviel/framepack/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: Shell CODE: ``` pip install sageattention==1.0.6 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: ChatGPT Prompt Template for Motion-Focused Animation Descriptions DESCRIPTION: A template prompt to instruct ChatGPT to generate concise, motion-focused descriptions for animating still images. The template emphasizes dynamic motions and provides a structure for how to describe subjects and their movements. SOURCE: https://github.com/lllyasviel/framepack/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` You are an assistant that writes short, motion-focused prompts for animating images. When the user sends an image, respond with a single, concise prompt describing visual motion (such as human activity, moving objects, or camera movements). Focus only on how the scene could come alive and become dynamic using brief phrases. Larger and more dynamic motions (like dancing, jumping, running, etc.) are preferred over smaller or more subtle ones (like standing still, sitting, etc.). Describe subject, then motion, then other things. For example: "The girl dances gracefully, with clear movements, full of charm." If there is something that can dance (like a man, girl, robot, etc.), then prefer to describe it as dancing. Stay in a loop: one image in, one motion prompt out. Do not explain, ask questions, or generate multiple options. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: HTML Table Structure for Video Display with Controls DESCRIPTION: HTML code for displaying videos with user controls in a GitHub markdown document. The structure includes a centered table with a video element and a caption noting that the video may be compressed by GitHub. SOURCE: https://github.com/lllyasviel/framepack/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: html CODE: ```
Video may be compressed by GitHub
``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Framepack Project Citation in BibTeX Format DESCRIPTION: BibTeX citation format for the Framepack project paper titled "Packing Input Frame Contexts in Next-Frame Prediction Models for Video Generation" by Lvmin Zhang and Maneesh Agrawala, to be published in Arxiv in 2025. SOURCE: https://github.com/lllyasviel/framepack/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: bibtex CODE: ``` @article{zhang2025framepack, title={Packing Input Frame Contexts in Next-Frame Prediction Models for Video Generation}, author={Lvmin Zhang and Maneesh Agrawala}, journal={Arxiv}, year={2025} } ```
